Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: election succession
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: The leader shall be elected by all free, adult colonists.

li.label: I don't like {TARGET}, and it can unseat {TARGET_objective}
I want a right to vote

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: lot succession
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: The leader shall be chosen randomly from all citizens. Considered not very democratic.

li.label: I don't want to take chances
I'll have a chance to rule
I don't want to lose my noble privileges

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: seniority succession
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: The oldest, and therefore most experienced, colonist shall be the leader. Considered non-democratic.

li.label: I don't want to lose my noble privileges

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: nobility succession
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: The pawn with the highest, and oldest, nobility title will be the leader. Considered non-democratic.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: martial succession
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: The most accomplished warrior will become our leader. Considered non-democratic.

li.label: I don't want to lose my noble privileges

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: quadrum-long term
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Set term of a leader to one quadrum (15 days).

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: half-year long term
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Set term of a leader to half a year (30 days).

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: year-long term
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Set term of a leader to one year (60 days).

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: indefinite term
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Leaders will rule till their death.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: impeach leader
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Immediately relieve the current leader of his or her duties and initiate a new succession.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: consent of the governed
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: A true leader never forgets about his or her people and draws authority from their support. The efficiency of the leader is affected by the citizens' median opinion of him/her.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: cancel "Consent of the Governed"
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: These fools just can't appreciate what the leader is really doing. We shouldn't care about their opinions any more.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: happiness for all
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: The goal of every government is happiness of its people. With this doctrine, the higher the median mood of your citizens, the slower the Governance decay.

li.label: the government should care about all citizens

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: cancel "happiness for all"
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: These unthankful people don't know what's good for them.

li.label: I wish the government cared more about my happiness

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: meritocracy
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: A smart citizen will choose the most capable candidates. Pawns with high skills are more likely to be voted for in elections.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: cancel meritocracy
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Those who can, do. Those who can't, rule.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: res publica
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Our nation is our common cause. When it is governed well, every citizen will be happier. When it is in trouble, everyone is.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: cancel "res publica"
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: It's not the business of the mob to think about the matters of the state!

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: stability doctrine
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: While the same leader is in charge, governance decay rate is much lower. But if leadership changes, for whatever reason, governance will drop by half.

li.label: I want to stay in charge

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: cancel "stability doctrine"
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: We need a more dynamic society.

li.label: I want to stay in charge

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: L'État, c'est moi
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: A happy leader is a productive leader. When the ruler is in a good mood, he, or she, will improve governance better.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: cancel "l'État, c'est moi"
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Elitism was a mistake, let us abolish it.

li.label: maybe someone will finally pay attention to me

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: cult of personality
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Our leader is an extraordinary person, who makes all decisions and bears ultimate responsibility for successes and failures. Every citizen will recognize that and love (or hate) the leader twice as much.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: cancel cult of personality
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: The leader should be more humble.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: state of emergency
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: When you declare a State of Emergency, all mental break thresholds are reduced by 3/4 for 3 days, and elections are postponed.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: lift state of emergency
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: The threat is over; we can return to business as usual.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: state ideoligion
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Only colonists that share the primary belief system have citizenship rights. This ideoligion will become more attractive, but disenfranchised colonists will be unhappy. Note: Canceling this decision later may be hard, especially if the state ideoligion opposes freedom of thought.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: abolish state ideoligion
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: All free, adult colonists shall have citizenship rights regardless of their ideoligion.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: multiculturalism
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Citizens' beliefs shall have no effect on their civil rights. Follower of any ideoligion can become the nation's political leader, but there will be no ideoligion leader. Followers of non-primary ideoligion will appreciate this equality.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: abolish multiculturalism
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Only representatives of the primary ideoligion shall be allowed to lead the nation. The political leader will also become his or her ideoligion's leader.

li.label: I lose a chance to become a leader
I gain the ideoligion leader title

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: social welfare
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Spend 100 silver per colonist to raise their loyalty by 10%.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: enable veto for actions
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: If the leader opposes a game action such as arresting or banishing pawns, he/she can stop it. Without veto power, such actions will be taken but at a cost of Governance.

Rimocracy.DecisionDef.label: abolish veto for actions
Rimocracy.DecisionDef.description: Leader can't prevent game actions, such as arresting or banishing pawns, from happening. Instead, they will reduce Governance if the leader opposes them.
